title: Use the Commutative Property
text: Group like variables together. The commutative property states that multiplication is reversible, so rearranging the variables has no effect on the answer.
speech: Group like variables together. The commutative property states that multiplication is reversible, so rearranging the variables has no effect on the answer.
pacedSpeech: Group like variables together. The commutative property states that multiplication is reversible, so rearranging the variables has no effect on the answer.

title: Add
text: Add the exponents for each variable together using the Product Property.
speech: Add the exponents for each variable together using the Product Property.
pacedSpeech: Add the exponents for each variable together using the Product Property.

title: Take Reciprocals
text: Since the exponents are negative, simplify by taking the reciprocal of the variables and making the exponent positive. This will be $$\frac{1}{p^3} \frac{1}{q^3}$$.
speech: Since the exponents are negative, simplify by taking the reciprocal of the variables and making the exponent positive. This will be  fraction, 1 over, p cubed,  fraction, 1 over, q cubed,  .
pacedSpeech: Since the exponents are negative, simplify by taking the reciprocal of the variables and making the exponent positive. This will be   fraction, 1 over, p cubed,  fraction, 1 over, q cubed,

title: Answer
speech: The answer is  fraction, 1 over, p cubed q cubed,  .
pacedSpeech: The answer is   fraction, 1 over, p cubed q cubed,
